allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add automated test for Temporal Java SDK skill

- Create complete Hello World Temporal application
- Include workflow and activity interfaces/implementations
- Add worker and client for end-to-end testing
- Use latest Temporal SDK version (1.32.0)
- Add automated test script with proper setup/teardown
- Include comprehensive README with troubleshooting guide
- Add Maven configuration with exec plugin
- Configure logging with logback

The test validates:
- Project structure and dependencies
- Workflow definition and execution
- Activity implementation and invocation
- Worker registration and polling
- Client workflow initiation
- End-to-end workflow completion
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Replace hello world test with skill validation test

Replace the previous application test with a proper skill validation
test that actually tests the temporal-java.md skill itself.

The new test:
- Reads and parses the temporal-java.md skill file
- Fetches the latest Temporal SDK version from Maven Central
- Generates a complete working application from skill patterns
- Validates that all patterns from the skill work correctly
- Builds and executes the generated application
- Verifies end-to-end workflow execution

This is a proper meta-test that validates:
✓ Skill file is readable and parseable
✓ Code examples are syntactically correct
✓ Latest version fetching works as documented
✓ Workflow/activity patterns compile
✓ Worker registration pattern works
✓ Client invocation pattern works
✓ Generated code executes successfully

Test is implemented in Python for easier markdown parsing
and project generation.
EOF
)")
